timeline.body:
AFAIS  it doesn't work like this; the method doesn't cover the case of multiple HUs for one line.
Rough sketch of how to do it instead:
* change the method to work with `de.metas.handlingunits.inventory.InventoryLine` instead of `I_M_InventoryLine`
  * maybe when it's not a dirty record we work with, the whole code can be moved out of this dirty service
* use `inventoryLine.getInventoryLineHUs()` to get the `n` HUs a line can have
* you probably need IHandlingUnitDAO to load the respective I_M_HUs; (maybe there is an easy way to load them all at once)
* use `IHandlingUnitsBL.getStorageFactory()` and IHUStorageFactory.getHUProductStorages() to get the quantities.
* maybe you don't need `uomConversionBL` to convert them to the inventory line's UOM..might be that's done by the repository (need to check)
* :exclamation: By the way: check out how the processes from today's book-club do it. maybe you can simply extract and/or reuse that code.
* fun fact: your change of `InventoryRepository.retrieveLineRecords` to `public` triggered all these thoughts..opening a nice API like that to server raw database records was kind of a smell :-D
* :exclamation: 
  * AFAIU InventoryLine is not really the aggregate root; Inventory is..
  * in the `M_InventoryLine` MI you need to update a single line though..not sure that to do
  * ..maybe let InventoryRepository load an inventory with just the line in question?
  * the good news is that AFAIK @teosarca will be around tomorrow for consultation
  * ...did i mention that there *might* be some code already doing all this?

AFAIS it doesn't work like this; the method doesn't cover the case of multiple HUs for one line.
Rough sketch of how to do it instead:

  • change the method to work with de.metas.handlingunits.inventory.InventoryLine instead of I_M_InventoryLine
    • maybe when it's not a dirty record we work with, the whole code can be moved out of this dirty service
  • use inventoryLine.getInventoryLineHUs() to get the n HUs a line can have
  • you probably need IHandlingUnitDAO to load the respective I_M_HUs; (maybe there is an easy way to load them all at once)
  • use IHandlingUnitsBL.getStorageFactory() and IHUStorageFactory.getHUProductStorages() to get the quantities.
  • maybe you don't need uomConversionBL to convert them to the inventory line's UOM..might be that's done by the repository (need to check)
  • ❗ By the way: check out how the processes from today's book-club do it. maybe you can simply extract and/or reuse that code.
  • fun fact: your change of InventoryRepository.retrieveLineRecords to public triggered all these thoughts..opening a nice API like that to server raw database records was kind of a smell :-D
